Generation IV.Diamond: It shakes its head back to front, causing its antennae to hit each other and sound like a xylophone.
Generation IV.Pearl: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.
Generation IV.Platinum: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.
Generation IV.HeartGold: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It shakes its head back to front, causing its antennae to hit each other and sound like a xylophone.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are the hallmarks of fall evenings.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: When the trees take on new hues, more of these Pokémon appear. The tone they create by striking their antennae together resembles that of the marimba, an instrument of foreign lands.

Generation IX.Violet: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.
